Diagnosis. ThIs spEcIEs cAN bE dIsTINGuIshEd fROm OThERs IN ThE cOmpLEx by ThE fEmALEs wITh ThE pOsTERIOR mARGIN Of ThE SGP NEARLy ROuNdEd; wITh ONLy A LOw cENTRAL cONcAvITy ANd INcONspIcuOus pOsTEROLATERAL cORNERs ( FIG. 4F ). ThE LATERAL mARGINs Of ThE SGP ARE NOT REfLExEd ANd ThE pOsTERIOR mARGIN Of LATEROsTERNITE VI Is sTRAIGhT ( FIG. 4F ). MALEs hAvE ThE AGP wIdEsT pREApIcALLy ( FIG. 4B ). ThE psEudOpARAmEREs hAvE A mEdIAL cONvExITy ANd TApER TO A NARROwLy ROuNdEd ApIcAL LObE ( FIG. 4C ). ThE scuTELLum hAs A NEARLy uNIfORmLy dARK bROwN cOLOR ( FIG. 4A ) ANd ThE dORsum Of ThE INsEcT Is NOTIcAbLy GLOssy.

FIGURE 4. Structures of

(A) dorsal habitus of female, (B) 6th and 7th abdominal terga of male, (C) 8th abdominal tergum of male, (D) ventral surface of phallosoma, (E) left side of phallososma, (F) sternum VI and subgenital plate of female (terminal abdominal segments removed). plc = posterolateral corner. Size bar = 0.5 mm and applies only to figures D and E.

WE hAvE ExAmINEd mORE ThAN 1,700 spEcImENs fROm EIGhT cOuNTRIEs ThROuGhOuT ThE RANGE Of ThIs spEcIEs; ALThOuGh vARIATION IN bOdy sIzE ANd EmbOLIum wIdTh Is EvIdENT, vARIATION IN mENsuRAL chARAcTERs Is NOT suffIcIENT TO suppORT ThE REcOGNITION Of subspEcIEs (sEE cOmmENTs IN ThE
A. californicus

Ambrysus pulchellus nitidulus
TO bE A juNIOR syNONym Of ThE NOmINATE subspEcIEs.

IN 1910, MONTANdON dEscRIbEd ThE subspEcIEs
A. pulchellus pallidulus
fROm TExAs , UNITEd STATEs . ThE dEscRIpTION wAs bAsEd ON spEcImENs cOLLEcTEd by GusTAv W. BELfRAGE ANd dEpOsITEd IN ThE USNM . MONTANdON sTATEd ThAT
A. p. pallidulus

A. nitidulus
. ALThOuGh NOT ExpLAINEd IN ThE ORIGINAL dEscRIpTION, IT Is LOGIcAL TO cONsIdER ThAT ThE spEcIfIc EpIThET
pallidulus
dERIvEs fROm ThE LATIN AdjEcTIvE " pallidus, " whIch mEANs "pALE," IN REfERENcE TO ThE pALE-yELLOw cOLORATION ON ThE hEAd ANd pRONOTum Of ThE subspEcIEs. AfTER ThE ExAmINATION Of spEcImENs cOLLEcTEd AT ROOsEvELT ( TExAs ), UsINGER (1946) NOTIcEd vARIATION IN cOLORATION, buT cONsIdEREd ThE wIdTh Of ThE EmbOLIA TO bE A cONsTANT fEATuRE ThAT cOuLd bE usEd TO dETERmINE ThIs TAxON; Thus, hE ELEvATEd ThE subspEcIEs
A. p. pallidulus
TO fuLL spEcIEs sTATus.

IN hIs wORK ON ThE
Ambrysus Of
ThE UNITEd STATEs , LA RIvERs (1951) dIsREGARdEd ThE TAxONOmIc chANGE mAdE by UsINGER (1946) ; ARGuING INTRAspEcIfIc vARIATION, hE pROpOsEd A. p. pallidullus As A syNONym

WE hAvE ExAmINEd ThE syNTypE spEcImENs usEd TO dEscRIbE ThE subspEcIEs, INcLudING ThE pALE cOLORATION ANd fAINT dARK mARKING ON ThE hEAd ANd pRONOTum, buT wE ATTRIbuTE ThEsE chARAcTERIsTIcs TO ThE cOLOR fAdING pROcEss. ThE dIffERENcE IN ThE EmbOLIA wIdTh Is subTLE ANd dOEs NOT REpREsENT AN INfORmATIvE chARAcTER upON whIch TO suppORT ITs sTATus As A subspEcIEs. Of A. pulchellus
; bAsEd ON ThIs ANd fOLLOwING ThE sAmE LOGIc fOR ThE syNONymy pROpOsEd fOR
A. p. nitidulus ,
wE pROpOsE
Ambrysus pulchellus pallidulus
ALsO TO bE A juNIOR syNONym Of
Ambrysus pulchellus pulchellus .
